metadata.title: The Story of the First Podcast Feed
metadata.description: When was the first podcast feed produced - and what is the history of the first podcast?
metadata.author: Eric Nuzum

metadata.title: Trump’s ban from Twitter creates the ultimate case of link rot in posts across the internet
metadata.description: Following a ban on his account by Twitter, embeds of President Trump’s original tweets are now displaying in articles across the internet as shadows of their former selves, some with just the text of the former tweet included, others as empty gray boxes.
metadata.author: Kim Lyons

metadata.title: Google crawl stats report now showing more crawls
metadata.description: Google said this is just a reporting change and the change you see in crawling is not reflective of any change in search results.
metadata.author: Barry Schwartz

metadata.title: It’s not just you: Why the current lockdown is having an extreme effect on mental health
metadata.description: For the majority of 2020, when asked how I was, I answered in all sincerity: basically fine. Like many others, I would break down if I thought too long about what was happening, or counted the days since I had last seen my family, but my daily life had in many ways improved. I was exercising regular…
metadata.author: Sarah Manavis

sections: After a conversation with former MTV DJ turned internet entrepreneur Adam Curry, blogging pioneer Dave Winer created the first RSS feed with an audio enclosure — the basis of podcasting — 20 years ago. Here's how it happened:
And finally: why you're feeling down

I don't know about you, but even though we have light at the end of the lockdown tunnel, with vaccinations underway, I've found this the hardest period of the pandemic yet. For me, part of that is the closure of schools: so many plans for life and work have been put on hold, including many for this site.
This piece goes a long way to explaining why.
